caption:
Connie was my favorite part 😂 (patbateman_edits/TT @tomholland2013 @jimmykimmellive) *all fake and props*

In June 2019, Tom Holland appeared on Jimmy Kimmel Live! to promote Spider-Man: Far From Home. During the show, they presented a humorous “deleted scene” featuring Holland’s character, Peter Parker, visiting a dry cleaner named Joe, portrayed by Kimmel, to pick up his Spider-Man suit. In the skit, Peter awkwardly explains that the suit is his pajamas, leading to a comedic exchange where Joe remains oblivious to Peter’s true identity. The scene plays on the classic superhero trope of maintaining a secret identity, with Kimmel’s character humorously failing to connect the dots despite obvious clues. This playful interaction delighted fans, showcasing Holland’s charm and Kimmel’s comedic timing. The skit added a lighthearted touch to the film’s promotion, emphasizing the relatable aspects of Peter Parker’s double life. It also highlighted the everyday challenges superheroes might face, such as mundane errands like picking up dry cleaning. Overall, the segment was a memorable and entertaining addition to the promotional campaign for the film.
